brief.brief: Report Writer is an information management tool designed to provide user-defined computer output.
- Extract any or all records from a database table and use the fields from these records as keys for extracting information from other tables.
- Perform mathematical calculations on specific fields selected from specific records.
- Perform conditional processing such as subtotaling, totaling, page breaks, etc.
- Print any selected record(s) or review it (them) on the screen.

detail.detail: Report Writer enables you to create any number of reports that print data from one or more database tables, using on of the database tables as the primary file.
The reports may be as simple or complex as you want. You can modify them at any time.
The Report Writer enables complete user-definition. You design a report form using Forms Designer in a similar way to designing a form to view database tables using the Database Manager.
You can create any number of forms for a report. First, access the Report Writer and name your report. Then design the report forms by accessing Forms Designer directly from the Report Writer.
Define these parts of your report:
Header: Labels or titles for column headings
Subheader: Labels or titles for column sub-headings (ONLY used for special types of reports)
Totals: Special variable fields to calculate specific numeric field information.
